title: ICE: broken MIR in DefId(0:3 ~ mutant[8787]::has_efiapi) (NoSolution): could not prove Binder(TraitPredicate(<i32 as Copy>), [])

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust #![feature(no_core, lang_items)] #![no_core] #[lang = "sized"] trait Sized {} #[lang = "copy"] trait Copy {} fn has_efiapi() { if let 0 = 1 {} } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.54.0-nightly (1025db84a 2021-05-14) binary: rustc commit-hash: 1025db84a68b948139b5adcd55da31bce32da8f3 commit-date: 2021-05-14 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.54.0-nightly LLVM version: 12.0.1 ``` ### Error output ``` warning: function is never used: `has_efiapi` --> mutant.rs:7:4 | 7 | fn has_efiapi() { | ^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: `#[warn(dead_code)]` on by default warning: 1 warning emitted error: internal compiler error: broken MIR in DefId(0:3 ~ mutant[8787]::has_efiapi) (NoSolution): could not prove Binder(TraitPredicate(), []) | = note: delayed at compiler/rustc_mir/src/borrow_check/type_check/mod.rs:252:27 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1021:13 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.54.0-nightly (1025db84a 2021-05-14) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: --crate-type staticlib query stack during panic: end of query stack ```
Backtrace

``` warning: function is never used: `has_efiapi` --> mutant.rs:7:4 | 7 | fn has_efiapi() { | ^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: `#[warn(dead_code)]` on by default warning: 1 warning emitted error: internal compiler error: broken MIR in DefId(0:3 ~ mutant[8787]::has_efiapi) (NoSolution): could not prove Binder(TraitPredicate(), []) | = note: delayed at compiler/rustc_mir/src/borrow_check/type_check/mod.rs:252:27 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1021:13 stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/1025db84a68b948139b5adcd55da31bce32da8f3/library/std/src/panicking.rs:493:5 1: std::panicking::begin_panic_fmt at /rustc/1025db84a68b948139b5adcd55da31bce32da8f3/library/std/src/panicking.rs:435:5 2: rustc_errors::HandlerInner::flush_delayed 3: ::drop 4: core::ptr::drop_in_place 5: as core::ops::drop::Drop>::drop 6: core::ptr::drop_in_place 7: rustc_span::with_source_map 8: rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run 9: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.54.0-nightly (1025db84a 2021-05-14) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: --crate-type staticlib query stack during panic: end of query stack ```
